draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall initial risk to be medium as a result of a occasional probability of a moderate severity event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to an seldom probability of a moderate severity event. Most Dangerous Risk: Cold Weather InjuryMitigation: Supervisors/NCO's and Leadership continuously monitor Soldiers for cold weather injuries and water intake. Vehicles has ample amount of water before leaving motor pool for training. Soldiers given safety brief on weather. If temperature drops below freezing at night, soldiers will be cycled through Strykers; which will be used as our heating mechanism. Most Likely Risk : Slips, Trips, and Falls with Heavy EquipmentMitigation: Ensuring proper PPE is worn during operations and slowing down any nonessential movement to ensure soldiers move heavy equipment in and out of vehicle safely. Par of the mitigation will be to briefed about weather conditions and empower soldiers to modify any surface deem unsafe before and during the training event.
